SENT.plain: Increased cell migration and invasion lead to cancer metastasis and are crucial to cancer prognosis
In this study, we explore whether FBXW7 plays any role in metastatic process
We show that depletion of FBXW7 induces epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) in human colon cancer cells along with the increase in cell migration and invasion
Moreover, FBXW7 deficiency promotes the generation of colon cancer stem-like cells in tumor-sphere culture
mTOR inhibition by rapamycin suppresses FBXW7 loss-driven EMT, invasion and stemness
Our results define the FBXW7/mTOR axis as a novel EMT pathway that mediates cancer invasion
